Package com.behreajj.camzup.core

Class Rgb

java.lang.Object
com.behreajj.camzup.core.Rgb
All Implemented Interfaces:
IColor, Comparable<IColor>
public class Rgb extends Object implements IColor
A mutable, extensible color class that stores red, green, blue and alpha in the range [0.0, 1.0]. Assumes color channels are in the standard RGB (sRGB) color space. Converts to and from integers where color channels are in the format 0xAARRGGBB.

  • Nested Class Summary

    static class

    Tone maps RGB channels using the Hable method.

  • Constructor Details

    • Rgb

      public Rgb()
      The default constructor. Creates a white color.

    • Rgb

      public Rgb(byte red, byte green, byte blue)
      Creates a color from bytes. In Java, bytes are signed, within the range [0x80, 0x7f] .The alpha channel defaults to 1.0.
      Parameters:
      red - the red channel
      green - the green channel
      blue - the blue channel

    • Rgb

      Parameters:

      green - the green channel
      blue - the blue channel
      alpha - the alpha channel

    • Rgb

      public Rgb(float red, float green, float blue)
      Creates a color out of red, green and blue channels. The alpha channel defaults to 1.0 .
      Parameters:
      red - the red channel
      green - the green channel
      blue - the blue channel

    • Rgb

      public Rgb(float red, float green, float blue, float alpha)
      Creates a color out of red, green, blue and alpha channels. The expected range for each channel is [0.0, 1.0], however these bounds are not checked to facilitate color mixing in other color spaces.
      Parameters:
      red - the red channel
      green - the green channel
      blue - the blue channel
      alpha - the alpha channel

    • fromHex

      public static Rgb fromHex(int hex, Rgb target)
      Converts a hexadecimal representation of a color stored as 0xAARRGGBB into a color. Does so by dividing each color channel by 255.
      Parameters:
      hex - the color in hexadecimal
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color

    • fromHex

      public static Rgb fromHex(String c, Rgb target)
      Attempts to convert a hexadecimal String to a color. Recognized formats include:
      • "abc" - RGB, one digit per channel.
      • "aabbcc" - RRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      • "abcd" - 5 bits per red, 6 bits per green, 5 bits per blue.
      • "aabbccdd" - AARRGGBB, two digits per channel.

      The output color will be reset if no suitable format is recognized. Checks for and removes "#" and "0x" prefixes.

      Parameters:
      c - the input String
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:
      • Integer.parseInt(String, int)
      • Long.parseLong(String, int)

    • lRgbToSrXyz

      public static Vec4 lRgbToSrXyz(float r, float g, float b, float a, Vec4 target)
      Converts a color from linear RGB to the XYZ coordinates for SR LAB 2. The values returned are in the range [0.0, 1.0]. See https://www.magnetkern.de/srlab2.html.
      Parameters:
      r - the red component
      g - the green component
      b - the blue component
      a - the alpha component
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the XYZ values

    • lRgbToSrXyz

      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the XYZ values

    • toGplString

      public static String toGplString(Rgb[] arr, String name)
      Returns a String representing the color array in the GIMP palette file format. The number of columns defaults to the square root of the array's length; for example, 16 colors would have 4 columns.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array
      name - the palette name
      Returns:
      the string
      See Also:
      • Utils.ceil(float)
      • Utils.sqrt(float)

    • toGplString

      public static String toGplString(Rgb[] arr, String name, int cols)
      Returns a String representing the color array in the GIMP palette file format. The number of columns is for displaying the palette.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array
      name - the palette name
      cols - the display columns
      Returns:
      the string

    • toGplString

      public static String toGplString(Rgb[] arr, String name, int cols, boolean useIdx)
      Returns a String representing the color array in the GIMP palette file format. The number of columns is for displaying the palette. A flag indicates whether to append the color's index as the final column of each row. Indices begin at 1, not 0.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array
      name - the palette name
      cols - the display columns
      useIdx - append the index
      Returns:
      the string
      See Also:
      • toGplString(StringBuilder)
      • toHexWeb(Rgb)

    • toHexWeb

      public static String toHexWeb(int c)
      Returns a web-friendly representation of the color as a hexadecimal code, preceded by a hashtag, '#', with no alpha. Assumes the number will be formatted as 0xAARRGGBB, where alpha is the first channel, followed by red, green and blue.
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      Returns:
      the string
      See Also:
      • toHexWeb(StringBuilder, int)

    • set

      public Rgb set(byte red, byte green, byte blue)
      Sets a color with bytes. In Java, bytes are signed, within the range [0x80, 0x7f] . The alpha channel defaults to 1.0 .
      Parameters:
      red - the red channel
      green - the green channel
      blue - the blue channel
      Returns:
      this color

    • set

      public Rgb set(float red, float green, float blue, float alpha)
      Sets the red, green, blue and alpha color channels of this color. The expected range for each channel is [0.0, 1.0], however these bounds are not checked to facilitate color mixing in other color spaces.
      Parameters:
      red - the red channel
      green - the green channel
      blue - the blue channel
      alpha - the alpha channel
      Returns:
      this color

    • toHexInt

      public int toHexInt()
      Converts a color to an integer where hexadecimal represents the color channels as 0xAARRGGBB. Defaults to modular arithmetic.
      Specified by:
      toHexInt in interface IColor
      Returns:
      the color in hexadecimal

    • toHexIntSat

      public int toHexIntSat()
      Converts a color to an integer where hexadecimal represents the color channels as 0xAARRGGBB. Uses saturation arithmetic. Two colors with unequal values beyond [0.0, 1.0] may yield equal integers.
      Specified by:
      toHexIntSat in interface IColor
      Returns:
      the color in hexadecimal
      See Also:
      • Utils.clamp01(float)

    • toHexIntWrap

      public int toHexIntWrap()
      Converts a color to an integer where hexadecimal represents the color channels as 0xAARRGGBB. Uses modular arithmetic, so out-of-gamut colors may cause overflow and unexpected hexadecimal colors.
      Specified by:
      toHexIntWrap in interface IColor
      Returns:
      the color in hexadecimal
